message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a medium access control (MAC) protocol for reliable all-to-all broadcast in vehicular networks, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper analyzes the performance of the proposed protocol over the packet erasure channel and provides an analytical approximation of the performance in the error floor region, which involves information theory concepts.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a protocol for vehicular networks, which can be considered as a system, and analyzes its performance, which involves control aspects.
4. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper does not explicitly mention cryptography and security, but the proposed protocol can have implications for security in vehicular networks.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper does not involve multimedia aspects, but the proposed protocol can be used for reliable broadcast of multimedia content in vehicular networks.
